title: Failed to show lifetime's compile error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
## Code

```Rust
#[derive(Clone)]
struct Wrapper<'data> {
    data: &'data str,
}

struct WillApplyFn<D, R, F: Fn(D) -> R> {
    data: D,
    func: F,
}

fn apply<D: Clone, R, F: Fn(D) -> R>(data: &D, func: F) -> WillApplyFn<D, R, F> {
    WillApplyFn {
        data: data.clone(),
        func,
    }
}

fn do_stuff<'data, 'ctx>(data: &'ctx Wrapper<'data>) -> u32 {
    let not_bugged = |data:  Wrapper| 0;
    let bugged     = |data: &Wrapper| 0; // Shouln't compile, ok

    // let WillApplyFn { data, func } = apply(data, not_bugged);
    let WillApplyFn { data, func } = apply(data, bugged);

    func(data)
}

fn main() {
    let data =  "crab";
    let data = Wrapper {
        data,
    };
    let r = do_stuff(&data);
    println!("{:?}", r);
}
```

## Stable

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.68.2 (9eb3afe9e 2023-03-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 9eb3afe9ebe9c7d2b84b71002d44f4a0edac95e0
commit-date: 2023-03-27
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.68.2
LLVM version: 15.0.6
```

### Error output

```

end of query stack
error: could not compile `the_crate`
```

## Nightly

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.69.0-nightly (1e225413a 2023-01-28)

host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.69.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.7
```
